00039 // Public-scope objects ------------------------------------------------------
00040 #if (QF_MAX_ACTIVE <= 8)
00041     QPSet8  volatile QK_readySet_;                          // ready set of QK
00042 #else
00043     QPSet64 volatile QK_readySet_;                          // ready set of QK
00044 #endif
00045                                          // start with the QK scheduler locked
00046 uint8_t volatile QK_currPrio_ = (uint8_t)(QF_MAX_ACTIVE + 1);
00047 uint8_t volatile QK_intNest_;                 // start with nesting level of 0

00050 //............................................................................
00051 //lint -e970 -e971               ignore MISRA rules 13 and 14 in this function
00052 char const Q_ROM * Q_ROM_VAR QK::getVersion(void) {
00053     static char const Q_ROM Q_ROM_VAR version[] = {
00054         ((QP_VERSION >> 12) & 0xF) + '0',
00055         '.',
00056         ((QP_VERSION >>  8) & 0xF) + '0',
00057         '.',
00058         ((QP_VERSION >>  4) & 0xF) + '0',
00059         (QP_VERSION         & 0xF) + '0',
00060         '\0'
00061     };
00062     return version;
00063 }
00064 //............................................................................
00065 void QF::init(void) {
00066     QK_init();           // QK initialization ("C" linkage, might be assembly)
00067 }
00068 //............................................................................
00069 void QF::stop(void) {
00070     QF::onCleanup();                                       // cleanup callback
00071     // nothing else to do for the QK preemptive kernel
00072 }
00073 //............................................................................
00074 void QF::run(void) {
00075     QK_INT_LOCK_KEY_
00076 
00077     QK_INT_LOCK_();
00078     QK_currPrio_ = (uint8_t)0;        // set the priority for the QK idle loop
00079     QK_SCHEDULE_();                      // process all events produced so far
00080     QK_INT_UNLOCK_();
00081 
00082     QF::onStartup();                                       // startup callback
00083 
00084     for (;;) {                                             // the QK idle loop
00085         QK::onIdle();                        // invoke the QK on-idle callback
00086     }
00087 }
00088 //............................................................................
00089 void QActive::start(uint8_t prio,
00090                     QEvent const *qSto[], uint32_t qLen,
00091                     void *tls, uint32_t flags,
00092                     QEvent const *ie)
00093 {
00094     Q_REQUIRE(((uint8_t)0 < prio) && (prio <= (uint8_t)QF_MAX_ACTIVE));
00095 
00096     m_eQueue.init(qSto, (QEQueueCtr)qLen);       // initialize the event queue
00097     m_prio = prio;
00098     QF::add_(this);                     // make QF aware of this active object
00099 
00100 #if defined(QK_TLS) || defined(QK_EXT_SAVE)
00101     m_osObject = (uint8_t)flags;       // m_osObject contains the thread flags
00102     m_thread   = tls;      // contains the pointer to the thread-local-storage
00103 #else
00104     Q_ASSERT((tls == (void *)0) && (flags == (uint32_t)0));
00105 #endif
00106 
00107     init(ie);                                    // execute initial transition
00108 
00109     QS_FLUSH();                          // flush the trace buffer to the host
00110 }
00111 //............................................................................
00112 void QActive::stop(void) {
00113     QF::remove_(this);                // remove this active object from the QF
00114 }
